JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in LOC , a town in LOC . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON PERSON , former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
A retired serviceman , the applicant sued his command for the provision of a flat and discharge allowance .

By a judgment of DATE , amended on appeal on DATE , ORG of FAC ordered the command to provide the applicant out of turn with a flat located at his last place of service and meeting statutory norms , and to pay him the discharge allowance due . This judgment became binding on DATE , but has not been fully enforced .
On an unspecified date the command paid to the applicant the discharge allowance .
On DATE the command offered the applicant a flat of CARDINAL m² in GPE , but the applicant refused this offer because he considered the flat too small .

On DATE ORG clarified the judgment 's mode of enforcement . According to the court , the command had to give to the applicant 's family a flat to be allocated to the command by federal authorities , or to pay to the applicant 's family a housing subsidy allocated to the command by federal or local authorities .

In DATE and DATE the command offered to the applicant CARDINAL other flats , but he refused them too . In DATE the command offered the applicant a flat under the ORG “ ORG ” , but the applicant refused this offer .
On bailiffs ' requests , in CARDINAL courts several times adjourned the enforcement because the applicant had refused the command 's offers , and because no other flats were available .
Under section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE .
